required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy & Safety of STG320 Sublingual Tablets of HDM Allergen Extracts in Adults and Adolescents With HDM-associated AR
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multi-center Study of the Efficacy and Safety of STG320 Sublingual Tablets of House Dust Mite (HDM) Allergen Extracts in Adults and Adolescents With HDM-associated Allergic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study was to assess the efficacy and safety of 12 months of treatment with 300 IR of STG320 sublingual tablets compared with placebo in adults and adolescents with HDM-associated allergic rhinitis.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study was a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase III study with 2 parallel arms in adults and adolescents with HDM-associated allergic rhinitis (AR) for at least one year.
The primary objective was to assess the efficacy of STG320 sublingual tablets at a daily dosage of 300 IR when administered for 12 months to adults and adolescents with HDM-associated AR. The primary efficacy variable was the average Total Combined Score.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Average Total Combined Score (TCS), calculated for each patient as the average of the non-missing daily TCSs during the primary evaluation period. The daily TCS (scale 0-15) was the sum of the patient's daily Rhinitis Total Symptom Score (RTSS, scale 0-12) and daily Rescue Medication Score (RMS, scale 0-3). Lower is better.

secondary_outcome.description: Average RTSS during the primary evaluation period. The daily Total Symptom Scores (RTSS) was the sum of the 4 rhinitis symptom scores: sneezing, rhinorrhoea, nasal pruritus and nasal congestion, each graded on a 4-point scale (0-3; 0: absent, 1: mild, 2: moderate, 3: severe). It ranges from 0 to 12. Lower is better.
Average RMS during the primary evaluation period. Rescue Medication Score (RMS) ; range 0-3, lower is better.

arm_group.description: 300 IR tablet of HDM Allergen Extracts

intervention.description: 300 IR tablet of HDM Allergen Extracts

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with HDM-associated allergic rhinitis (AR) for at least 1 year
- Patients sensitized to D. pteronyssinus (D. pte) and/or D. farinae (D. far) defined on skin prick test and HDM-specific serum IgE
Main Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of rhinitis, rhinoconjunctivitis or asthma to allergens other than HDM, likely to result in rhinitis symptoms during the evaluation periods
- Partly controlled or uncontrolled asthma
- Controlled asthma requiring controller treatment(s) consistent with GINA 2014 treatment Steps 3 to 5

overall_official.affiliation: CHU Arnaud de Villeneuve, Montpellier, France
University of South of Florida, Tampa, USA

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted between 29 September 2015 (first patient, first visit) and 25 June 2018 (last patient, last visit).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 2,174 (50.9%) and 486 (11.4%) patients were excluded before and during the placebo run-in period, respectively. The main reason for screen failures at these two stages was a failure to meet randomization criteria.

group.title: 300 IR
group.description: 300 IR tablet of HDM Allergen Extracts

baseline.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all randomized patients who received at least one dose of the IP of treatment period and had at least one primary efficacy evaluation during the overall treatment period.

group.title: 300 IR
group.description: 300 IR tablet of HDM Allergen Extracts

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Total Combined Score
outcome.description: Average Total Combined Score (TCS), calculated for each patient as the average of the non-missing daily TCSs during the primary evaluation period. The daily TCS (scale 0-15) was the sum of the patient's daily Rhinitis Total Symptom Score (RTSS, scale 0-12) and daily Rescue Medication Score (RMS, scale 0-3). Lower is better.
outcome.population: The FAS included all randomized patients (pts) who received at least one dose of the IP of treatment period and had at least one primary efficacy evaluation during the overall treatment period: 1,476 pts. Among these pts, only those with efficacy evaluation during the primary evaluation period were included in the primary analysis: 1,262 pts.

analysis.p_value_desc: Source Model: Type III effects Covariates: Treatment group, Gender, Age Class, Sensitization Status, Asthma Status, Pooled Center, Baseline Average RTSS.

outcome.title: Average Rhinitis Total Symptom Score (RTSS)
outcome.description: Average RTSS during the primary evaluation period. The daily Total Symptom Scores (RTSS) was the sum of the 4 rhinitis symptom scores: sneezing, rhinorrhoea, nasal pruritus and nasal congestion, each graded on a 4-point scale (0-3; 0: absent, 1: mild, 2: moderate, 3: severe). It ranges from 0 to 12. Lower is better.
outcome.population: The FAS included all randomized patients (pts) who received at least one dose of the IP of treatment period and had at least one primary efficacy evaluation during the overall treatment period: 1,476 pts. Among these pts, only those with efficacy evaluation during the primary evaluation period were included in the secondary analysis: 1,262 pts.

reported_events.desc: Safety variables were adverse events (AEs) monitored throughout the study and data from physical examinations and clinical laboratory assessments. 1,607 patients were randomized. 6 patients randomized by mistake did not receive any IP of the treatment period and were excluded from the Safety Set. Accordingly, the Safety Set comprised 1,601 patients.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Martine Le Gall, Director of Clinical Development
